_header: A noble emperor come sith that hight Constantine
Note: This is incorporated in the Laud poem, Sancta Crux — see 3387.
_description: The Invention of the Cross, in the South English Legendary — in couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
A noble emperour þus com seþþe þat het
                    constantynIn batail he was so muche þat þus nas of no
                    fyn…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…Quiriac þonkede oure lord crist wiþ gret Ioie he is
                    nom& tok hem eleyne þe gode quene þo he to hire
                    com
BodAsh43.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             Legends of the Holy Rood, Symbols of the Passion, and
                Cross-Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 46 (1871); repr. 1973: 36-47.

Bod779.First Lines:
A noble emperour com syþ þat het constauntinIn batayle he
                    was so moche þat nas of no fyn…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…vs so werie with þe rode þe fendes fonding wit
                    stondeboþe by nyȝt & by daye a water & ek
                    alonde
Bod779.Note:
Heading comes at top of page, 146v, with last four lines of
                        5339 after it; though large
                    decorated initial comes at beginning of this text.
Bod779.Attributed Title: Þe finding of þe þre rodis (f. 146v)

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Seoþþe þer com an Emperour þat het ConstantynIn
                    werre and batayle he was so muche þat þer nas no
                    fyn…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þat heo bi sechen God for vs þat on þe Roode
                    schedde his bloodÞat we mote to þe ioye of heuene come þat
                    is so swete and god. Am[en].
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             Legends of the Holy Rood, Symbols of the Passion, and
                Cross-Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 46 (1871); repr. 1973: 36-47.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
A Noble emperour com sithe þat het constantinIn bataill he was
                    so michel þat þer was of no fin…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Quiriak þanked oure lord crist with gret Ioye he hem
                    nom& tok hem Eleyne þe gode quen þo he to hire
                    com
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

BodTan17.First Lines:
A noble emperour þere cam siþe þat hiȝte
                    constantinIn bataile he was so meche þat þer was þer of no
                    fyn…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…Quiryak þankid oure lord & wiþ gret ioye hem
                    nomAnd tok hem elene þe goode quen þo he þider
                    com
BodTan17.Note:
No large initial to indicate beginning of text; follows as if part of
                        5339.

OxfTri57.First Lines:
A noble emperour þer com suþþe þat het
                    ConstantynIn bataille he was so moche þat þer nas of no
                    fyn…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…Quiriake þonkede oure lord crist with gret ioye he hem
                    nomAnd tok hem Elene þe guode Quene þo he to here com

CamCCC145.First Lines:
A Noble emperor þer com suþþe þat het
                    constantinIn bataille he was so muche þat þer nas of no
                    fin…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Quiriac þonkede oure louerd crist wiþ gret ioie he is
                    nomAnd tok is Eleine þe gode quene þo he to hure com
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
A Noble Emperour þer com suþþe þat het
                    ConstantynIn Batayle he was so goed þat þer of nas no
                    ffyn…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Quyriak þonkede oure lord crist wiþ gret ioye he ham
                    nomAnd to þe queene he ham tok anon so he to hure com

CamTCC605.First Lines:
A noble emperour com suþþe þat hete constantynIn
                    bataile he was so muche þer nas þerof no fyn…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…quyrac þonkyd oure lord with Ioie he hem nome& toke
                    hem þe goud quene þo he to hure come
CamTCC605.Note:
No rubric initial to indicate beginning of text; follows as if part of
                        5339.

Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.25.

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
A Noble emperor þer com suþþe þat het
                    constantynIn bataile he was so muche þat þer nas of no
                    fin…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…quiriac þonkede oure lorde crist wiþ gret Ioye he
                    þis nomAnd toke þis eleyne þe gode quene þo he to hure
                    com
BLAdd10301.Attributed Title:
Constantinus Maxencius Inperator (f. 77v, by scribe in
                    margin beside first line); Inuencione sancte crucis (RT)

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: A noble emperour þer com suþþe þat het constantinIn bataile he was so moche þat þer nas of no fin…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …quiriac donkeþ oure lord crist wit gret ioie he is nom& tok hom eleyne þe gode quene þo he to hire com

BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Quirat þonkede oure lord wiþ ioie he hem nomAnd tok hem þe gode quene þo he to hire com

BLEge2810.First Lines: A noble amperour suþþe þeire com þat het constantynIn bataile he was so muche þat þer of nas no fin…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …Quiriac þonkid oure louird crist wiþ gret Ioye he is nomAnd toke is elene þe gode quene þo he to hire com

BLEge2891.First Lines: A Nouble emperor þer com suþþe þat het constantynIn bataille he was so muche þat þer nas of no fyn…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …Quiriak þonkede oure louerd crist wiþ gret ioie he is nomAnd tok is Eleine þe gode quene þo he to hure com
BLEge2891.Note: “Constantine” added in margin by a later hand, f. 75v.

BLHar2250.First Lines:
Qwen Elene come to Ierusalem seche a rede ho nomeÞat alle
                    þe Iewes of þe cite bifore hyr shulde come…
BLHar2250.Last Lines:
…Þat þai besechen hit for vs þat on þe rode
                    shedde his blodeÞat we mowen to þe ioy come of heuen þat is
                    so gode

BLHar2277.First Lines: A noble Emperour þer com suþþe þat het ConstantinIn bataille he was moche þat þer nas of no fyn…
BLHar2277.Last Lines: …Quiriac þonkede oure louerd crist wiþ gret ioye he hem nom& tok hem Eleyne þe gode quene þo he to hire com
BLHar2277.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 2277.

Lam223.First Lines:
But siþen þer come an emperour þat hett ConstantynIn
                    were & batel he was so wise þat þerof was no
                    fyne…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Þat þai pray for vs þat on þe Rode shedde his
                    blodeÞat we may to þe ioye come of heuen þat is so gode
                    Amen

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
An noble Emperour þer come siþ þat hight
                    ConstantynIn bataille he was so myghty þer was of hym no
                    fyn…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Quiriak þonked our lord and wiþ gret Ioie hem
                    nomeAnd took hem Elene þe good quene whan he to her come
